content: The NLRA, as amended, aims to improve workers' bargaining power by allowing them to join or form labor unions and collectively bargain over wages and working conditions. It seeks to eliminate obstacles to the free flow of commerce and stabilize competitive wage rates. The NLRA gives workers the right to join or form a labor union, bargain collectively over wages and working conditions, and requires employers to bargain in good faith with a union chosen by a majority of employees.
